caption.p: Contentious issues and unanswered questions regarding diabetes and COVID-19.

tr.td: Are people with well-controlled diabetes at higher risk of getting COVID-19 infection than non-diabetic individuals?
Is there any effect of obesity on the severity of COVID-19 in people with diabetes?
Is there any specific diet or supplement which could help patients of diabetes and COVID-19?
What is the role of renin angiotensin aldosterone system (RAAS) and inhibitors of RAAS in determining the predisposition to COVID-19 and its severity?
Do different anti-hyperglycaemic drugs have different effects on the disease course in COVID-19?
Is the viral clearance slower in patients with diabetes (which could mean higher infectivity)?
Can COVID-19 lead to beta-cell dysfunction/destruction?
Is there an effect of COVID-19 directly on diabetes-related complications independent of glycaemic deterioration?
What are the effects of ‘lockdown’ on glycaemia and diabetes-related complications?
Does reduction in air pollution because of restrictions on vehicular movement and industries have a beneficial role in control of blood glucose?
Can telemedicine help in management of diabetes in the times of COVID-19?
Is it useful and/or feasible to screen all people with diabetes for SARS CoV-2?
Are there any ethnicity-specific factors determining the different risk of infection, disease severity and mortality rates in different regions?
